description: Fish N Gari is a new Sushi restaurant on Polk street that offers quick and inexpensive Japanese style food.  The lunch bento box is a good deal (under $10).  Portions are small, but sufficient.  I had salmon teriyaki and a hamachi roll with miso soup, rice and salad.  Everything tasted good and was flavorful.  Service was speedy.  This isn't a place for finding artisan sushi to brag to your foodie friends about, but it is a good choice for a quick lunch.
author: Seth G.

description: I have been eating at Fish N Gari at least once a week for about a year and its just plain good, fast and friendly. Service is very fast most of the time and I like that its small and personal. I think its great value and the food is excellent.
author: Guido W.

description: Great neighborhood sushi restaurant. Tom is the best and will take care of you. The place has a tv at the small sushi bar if you want to catch a game. The prices are very reasonable and I've never had anything but great service.
author: Brandon L.

description: The food was ok but the service was unacceptable.  There are only 7 tables and 3 seats at the sushi bar.  The the restaurant was not full but busy and they probably had a lot of take out orders but I never received a set of chopsticks and napkin and my beer and water took 5 minutes to get to me...and then it took over 30 minutes for me to get my meal which was only a tekka maki and gyoza.  The table that came in after me and ordered after received their food first!  I've never not tipped at a restaurant but this time I did.  I was a little embarrassed walking out but they were terrible.  I will not go back!
author: Shirley C.

description: Best sushi place ever. Fish are fresh plus the employees are so welcoming. I'd come back anytime.
author: Kells B.

description: We are  hoping to support our new neighbors Fish n Gari as they are new to our neighborhood so my department decided to give them a try yesterday after seeing so many positive Yelp reviews.  Unfortunately, our decision ended up being a poor one because 3 out of 6 staff got sick from the food later that day.  Good news is that a 4th staff member didn't get sick.  Only  because she was smart enough to throw away her order of the spicy tuna roll.  She said that it smelled so bad and not fresh at all..trust the nose is one reasons the human race survived for millions on years.  I hope your business the best but our company will no longer be returning in the future.
author: K H.

description: Disappointed!  I do a lot of ordering through Grub Hub, and Fish N Gari has been my go to place for sushi the past couple of weeks.  Last night I ordered my usual and waited 10 minutes past the time for the schedule delivery to call and find out what was going on with my order.  At first the young woman who answered said, the order was about to leave, and then corrected herself and said it was already on it's way and that the driver was backed up with multiple orders.  Nearly 30 more minutes went by before i received my order.  Not only were the rolls sloppily put together, but the seaweed salad was still nearly frozen.  I called to make her aware, and while she was apologetic, nothing was done to remedy the problem.
author: Marcelino U.

description:
I pretty much never yelp, but these guys deserve at least a bit of a review from me.

This is hands down the best sushi spot in the neighborhood. Its probably not the very best sushi I've ever had, but everything I've tried (and I usually eat here 1-2 times a week these days) is great, and the prices are incredibly affordable. There is literally nothing comparable in either quality or price without travelling to the far ends of the city.

Tom, the owner is very friendly and does a great job. The fish is very fresh and tasty, and all the other options are good. Gyoza just crispy enough, the tempura light and delicious.

The best deals are the Bento boxes. You get to choose either 2 or 3 items from a fairly extensive list. I usually get a mixed tempura, spicy tuna roll, and tonkatsu bento, and they all come with a small salad, rice, and Miso soup. Approx. $11-13 for all that.

Bonus points for fresh hot free green tea while you wait, and as many refills as you want.

I prefer Fish n Gari for lunches, as it is slow, and the prices even better so service and wait times are negligible, but dinners are also good, you just might have to wait a few more minutes for your food.

Don't believe the one star snobs, this place is great and worth at least a trip or two. Everyone I've brought here has been impressed and these guys really deserve a bit more business.

Give em a try, and ignore the haters!
author: Brendan H.

description: One of my favorite spots on the busy polk street corridor. Great for small parties and date nights. Amazing vegetarian rolls and meatless options. The owners are so sweet and welcoming; one of those places that make you feel as if each person in the joint was VIP. Make sure to see their sake list as it never disappoints. I'm a huge fan of these guys, and make the restaurant a reliable staple in my dine out neighborhood repertoire.
author: Nathan T.

description: Really enjoyed Fish N Gari. We stopped by for a quick bite and were really pleased with everything we had. It was a Monday and, in the area, not many Sushi spots are open; so we decided to stop in. The service was great; very attentive and friendly. They made us feel very comfortable. When ordering sushi, our order is pretty standard and unvaried and Fish N Gari was really good and held up to most other sushi we've had in the city. Give them a try!
author: Joel D.

description: This place is worth 5 stars for the honey walnut shrimp alone! Great local sushi place with friendly service on Polk. Well worth a visit.
author: guy H.

description: Awesome honey walnut and snow beauty rolls.. We always order multiple orders! Also, the staff are always super friendly and enthusiastic. I highly recommend this place.
author: Stephanie T.

description: I used to eat at Fish N Gari weekly when my daughter went to preschool in the area last year. It's an affordable and tasty sushi restaurant run by a really great guy. Thomas, the owner, made us feel at home and was always so accommodating to my two kids, aged 4 and 2. The fish is fresh, and the other food is good, too. My kids always gobbled down their udon, and I usually got a bento box. The lunch bentos are very affordable.
author: Jeanie K.

description: Recently went to this place and had the dragon roll and nigiri (salmon, butterfish, spicy hotate) it was good and the prices reasonable so maybe they've improved since the last 1 star reviews.
author: N A.

description: Casual, friendly, by far the best sushi all up and down Polk street.  The daily specials are always great. The sushi ranges from pretty darn good to very, very good.  I don't understand the bad reviews here. I am a sushi aficionado, having sampled every level quality of sushi in SF, NY and Japan.  This is not a destination restaurant perhaps, but it is truly outstanding in Polk gulch.  It's become my go-to sushi place when I want to stick to my neighborhood.
author: Nancy F.

description: Friendly staff, yummy rolls, and 2 blocks from my house!
author: Carel H.

description: This place sucks. Went there this past Saturday for dinner around 6 pm. My friend ordered the bento box with chicken katsu and beef and I also ordered the bento box with beef and chicken teriyaki. We also ordered a spicy salmon roll. We waited about 30 minutes before we got our bento boxes. The beef was burned and overcook and my chicken was cold. My friend's beef was the same as mine. The place was not busy as we were the only ones there for quite awhile. Someone ordered takeout over the phone and I think they just forgot our order and rushed it. But anyway, when we complain, the waitress and the guy who prepared our sushi didn't make us a new beef teriyaki but instead took 15% off our bill. Instead of complaining more we paid and left. What a rip-off. Avoid this place terrrible service and food. My one and only time there.
author: Henry C.
